description:
To carry out tree surgery - 
Option 1: To crown reduce by 1m and remove any deadwood to one English Oak at T2 within TPO 485. 

Option 2: To reduce all limbs that are closest to the property by 1 meter and remove any deadwood within the tree to one English Oak at T2 within TPO 485.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: "The oak tree is located in the front garden of 30 Clovelly Close, Pinner. It appears to be healthy and is a mature, prominent feature in the area.

The tree is visible from properties and public areas on Chamberlain Way, Burlington Close, and from the rear of some properties on Tolcarne Drive. Although there are signs of previous pruning, the crown remains attractive and can be seen from multiple viewpoints.
Within the application, the applicant provided a covering letter from All Seasons Tree Services Ltd. outlining two options for potential tree work, as described above.

On 08/02/2024, an application (58499/TRE/2023/299) was rejected for a 30% crown reduction on the grounds that the work was excessive and would introduce multiple large pruning wounds to the tree. Comments were made within the Officers Report that we would be more open to a reduction on one or more limbs that are closest to the property to help alleviate the issues caused.
Option 1 within this application is to c
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.

Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981:  Note that it is an offence under this act to disturb roosting bats, nesting birds or any other protected species.  Therefore, if applicable, it is advisable to consult your tree surgeon / consultant to agree an acceptable time for carrying out the approved works.
Owner(s)'s permission:  Permission should be sought from the owner(s) of the tree(s) and / or the owner(s) of the land that the tree(s) overhang prior to any approved work being carried out.

Expected standard of tree work: The approved works must be carried out in accordance with the conditions laid out above. If they are not, then enforcement action could being taken which could lead to prosecution and heavy fines. Therefore, it is highly recommended that the works are only carried out by a professional and competent arboriculturist who undertakes to comply with the conditions of this consent and in accordance with industry best practice (BS 3998:2010). The Arboricultural Association can provide details of its approved contractors, who have demonstrated such professionalism and competence, on their website (www.trees.org.uk) or by calling 01242 522152. Or on request the Council can provide a list of contractors who are known to carry out tree work to a good standard and to normally maintain an appropriate policy of indemnity insurance.

To reduce all limbs that are closest to the property by 1 meter and remove any deadwood within the tree to one English Oak at T2 within TPO 485 (on the condition (Conds. Sec. 8) that the clearance of the tree branches to the property is a maximum 2m when completed).
To crown reduce by 1m one English Oak at T2 within TPO 485.

"The length of the lateral limb(s) of the tree to be pruned shall be tip-reduced by a maximum of 2m clearance to the property. This work shall comprise a reduction in the length of the limb(s) in a uniform and systematic manner and the limb(s) should be cut back to suitably positioned secondary branches.
The work shall result in a tree of typical form for the species and of balanced appearance. The level of limb reduction shall be expressed as a level of clearance to be provided.

The works shall be carried out in accordance with the recommendations contained in BS3998: 2010 - ""British Standard Recommendations for Tree Work"".  Climbing irons or 'spikes' shall not be used during the execution of the work.
In order to protect health of the tree and the visual amenity of the area."
